content: pop-it sensory fidget by kim ethridge this is a very quick and easy pattern that describes how to make a single pop-it bubble it can be used to make keychains or multiple bubbles can be made and stitched together to make a larger pop-it toy in theory you can even make an entire blanket with these if you so desire each bubble is worked in the round and works up quickly with scrap yarn customizations are endless the final shape around the outside of each bubble is a hexagon if you would prefer a square i have included an alternative final round r7a as always i would encourage you to get creative and make it your own i love seeing your work and i m always available to answer questions ethridge101@yahoo com notes yarn medium weight in any color hook size g or similarly sized hook other supplies stitch marker yarn or tapestry needle gauge not important for this project stitches used chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet magic_ring - https //www wikihow com/crochet-a-magic-ring r1 6 single_crochet in magic_ring r2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet r3-5 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 3 rounds switch colors r6 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 single_crochet r7 single_crochet in next 4 single_crochet chain 1 6 times 24 single_crochet 6 chain 1 r7a single_crochet in next 6 single_crochet chain 1 4 times 24 single_crochet 4 chain 1 finish off and work in ends
